intro: Eschweilera mattos-silvae, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a species of tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Lecythidaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood with a rich, reddish-brown color. The plant has large, simple leaves that are typically elliptical in shape and have a smooth texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, spherical fruits. Due to its high value for musical instruments, it is also considered an endangered species.
